intro: Weinmannia polystachia, commonly known as the silverleaf weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silvery hairs that give it a distinctive appearance. Weinmannia polystachia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
